website_summaries.verdict: The Rolls Royce of weather stations, this expensive device rivals most pro-grade units.
pros: Large LCD constantly displays real-time data
Sophisticated readings and accuracy with (almost) zero lag
cons: Pricey, but you are paying for quality and an advanced feature set

customer_reviews.title: This is their market - Sell bad design and re-sell when it fails
customer_reviews.text: This is the second I have owned. No more. The solar charging system keeps going out. The last one lasted 1 year 3 months. Capacitor is not serviceable, and goes out regularly. This is their market - Sell bad design and re-sell when it fails.
customer_reviews.author: Infoman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money.
customer_reviews.text: Problem is,their engineers have the thing to read the WIND the opposite of what I'am use to...IE: If the wind is blowing out of the South(warm air) the console will have arrows pointing from the North.It is Conveying where the WIND IS GOING TO instead of WHERE IT IS COMING FROM.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Davis WS i have owned in my life. First one lasted 15 years and i sold it with the house when i moved. My current one i have had for 2 years and it is worthless. Every sensor on the thing is wrong. Worst part is you can't broadcast to WU without additional hardware, which adds hundreds more to the purchase price. Davis has a crap website that you can publish data to, but it only updates every 15 minutes unless you pay a monthly fee. Total nonsense! Come on Davis, get it together or you will find yourself out of business. Ambient Weather WS-2902 is the way to go IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: sahallie

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Did not even last a year before it broke. I started getting a low battery signal from the receiver due to the fact I am in a very rural area in Costa Rica I had trouble finding the battery. When I finally replaced it a week latter the same thing happened I called customer service after 15min wait I was helped its due to a bad compositor I would have to send in the entire unit cost $100 plus shipping. This thing is a POS do not buy it and a very bad warrantee.
customer_reviews.author: gregg mufson

customer_reviews.title: Have low expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I've had other brand stations, but I bought this Davis model because of the company's history of quality products. Set up (including WeatherLink) took the better part of a full day and required also buying a datalink that wasn't mentioned in the purchase materials. After about a month, the outdoor temperature and humidity sensors went bad. I called technical support, expecting competent help. My first encounter, after 15 minutes on hold, was with a rep who emailed me a solution that even he admitted wasn't going to work. I did as instructed and had to call back again. I was able to talk to a helpful person who is sending me a replacement unit. All in all, fairly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: RandyCadenhead

customer_reviews.title: Item is what I expected - BATTERY COVER AND BATTERY MISSING
customer_reviews.text: I am very excited about the Vantage Vue Weather Station and opened it to assemble. During the assembly I noticed that the "factory installed" lithium battery and the battery cover were missing. I immediately sent a note and asked for the battery and cover to be replaced. I did not want to return the item. The response (in grammatically incorrect sentences) indicated the order was not placed with VirVentures - and yet that is the reference in the order. I want the battery and the battery cover, for this price and item that doesn't seem unreasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Lon C Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after six months.
customer_reviews.text: Weather station was wonderful when we first got it set up. After six months of use it stopped working. Davis has told us to buy a new one - because due to moving to a new home and then winter, we waited a bit to install after initial purchase and we're out of warranty. Regardless, the product stopped working after six months with no fixes available.
customer_reviews.author: LKD

customer_reviews.title: Very nice unit, and seems to be accurate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, and has good range. I thought the thermometer was off, because it read 10 to 15 degrees above my existing ones. After putting one of my remote reading thermometers up next to it, I found there can be that much difference between 5' and 35' elevation. Depending on the wind, it reads the same temp. In a heavy snow, it will build up in the rain collector and block the wind cups from spinning. On a 35' tower, it's hard to get cleared out, without climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Ross

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Enhales VERY Strongly
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this weather station, I had a Vantage Pro. On the Pro, the battery would last close to one year. On the VUE, I have to replace the station battery every month. Just in case I wasn't very clear, I have had to replace the station battery EVERY month since I purchased the weather station (October 2018). I DO NOT recommend the VUE.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Am very disappointed. I was led to believe that the Davis ...
customer_reviews.text: Am very disappointed. I was led to believe that the Davis weather station was top of the line. I had to have the console replaced at less than a year under warranty. Now a little over a year later it transmits, but sends no data. Davis tech says probably around $100.00 plus shipping to repair. I've had two weather stations that cost less than half what the Davis cost that lasted around four to five years each. I thought for the money I'd have a trouble free station for several years. I'm going back to the cheaper stations and trashing the Davis. I learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Cannot reccomend; new software 2.0  update results in a loss of service
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these stations (different locations) set up with the WeatherLinkIP Data Logger. The Davis Instruments new update 2.0 of their apps results in a big loss of data online without a pay of play setup. No longer worth the price for the limited info now available.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: An exceptional device
customer_reviews.text: Another great device from Davis, but I have noticed that the company no longer includes the hardware and software applications for controlling your local weather. My older model allowed me to cause some real havoc within 1000 yards of my home. I would make it snow in the summer and rain out my neighbor's cooks out on the weekends. I especially enjoyed the "plague of frogs" button. No longer. Still, it's a great piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Philistine Frank

customer_reviews.title: wireless battery goes dead in 2-5 days then no outside reading on console.
customer_reviews.text: No matter what brand battery I use, duracell, Energiser, Interstate, the battery looses voltage down to 2 volts in 2-5 days. I paid a lot of money to get what I thought was the best, only to be disappointed. I HAD accurite with better results for 1/3 the price. I believe I may go back to Accurite. Will wait to see if Davis responds. At this time I would NOT buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Voisine

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with the package open. the console worked for less than a day. It appears Davis or Amazon mailed this defective unit back out to the next, new, unsuspecting customer. Amazon return was easy, but Ill not buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: happy in az

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I received the Vantage Vue 6250 last week and mounted it 13' off the ground on 1-1/4 EMT. In the last few days we've experienced almost 10 inches of rain and numerous thunderstorms. The device functioned perfectly. I verified the accuracy by comparing the readings I was getting vs. the readings posted at our local executive airport which is located about 2 miles from my home. They were right on the money. I'm a NOAA trained Advanced Storm Spotter and the Vantage Vue 6250 will help me tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: Bluegrass Bob

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal!! Can't go wrong!!
customer_reviews.text: While it is not the cheapest out there, I learned the hard way. DO NOT buy a cheaper one than this! I has an Ambient Weather WS-2080 before this one and did nothing but fix issues where the console was not picking up the transmitter, dirty data, console/software could not figure out what the barometric pressure was given your altitude, and incorrect temperature readings to start my list. All of that was solved with this station!! Be sure you also get the data logger for this console. I promise you will not be disappointed!!! I upload my data to WeatherUnderground and CWOP so I needed something that worked correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Bass Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great weather instrument
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy is very good. Normally the rain gauge is within a point or two of my original manual read rain gauge. Which is what I report with. But I like to see how much rain I get without going outside and this has filled the bill. Also, we like to record wind speed/direction when we are spraying in case of a drift complaint. I’m very happy with it and hopefully it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Good for five years!
customer_reviews.text: I like this unit pretty well. I purchased it on November 17, 2012. So...it has lasted just about five years. About a year ago, it quite recording precipitation, then started in again about six months later. About a week ago it stopped recording the outside temperature. Given the cost, I guess I've got about sixty dollars a year in it. It has withstood wind gusts up to 65 mph or so, and has generally been reliable through the last five years (when compared to other weather stations reporting near me on Weather Underground). Given my recent experience with pedometers (0 for 4) I think I may risk another round at bat with this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Backcreek

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad, as his old Davis wired weather station I bought him 26 years ago finally died after a lightning strike. Nothing like Davis for quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Ceola

customer_reviews.title: No data port in base product
customer_reviews.text: For a $300 product, the basic expectation is to be able to access the data using a data port. But they are asking to spend another $100+ for data logger. Very disappointed. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Reddy

customer_reviews.title: was pretty simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't wait to get this thing up and running. was pretty simple to set up. I went straight to Menards and grabbed a 1-3/4 10' stick of PVC so I would have plenty of material to work with the best mount site whether it be on side of house, garage, or free standing. I`ll give it another 2 Stars if it s still operating in 5 yrs !!
customer_reviews.author: HL S. Weatherly

customer_reviews.title: Help is available and was very patient with this old guy
customer_reviews.text: As a senior citizen I struggled some with the instructions and finally called the tech services for help. He walked me through, patiently and step by step, and in the process discovered that one function was not working properly (which was why I was having trouble). No problem! They sent a new unit out that day, I got it the next day, put it together easily by myself. I'm very pleased with the unit and wish I'd replaced my old one years earlier.
customer_reviews.author: mumpsimus

customer_reviews.title: I call Davis and was talked through several things like changing the addresses between the control panel and the ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 years and still having issues with the temperature and wind speed reading all the time. I call Davis and was talked through several things like changing the addresses between the control panel and the station, changing the rechargeable batteries in unit, changing the location of the outside unit, but nothing ever worked. Just depends on the day as to weather all the info is being transmitted! Pretty disappointed because of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting tech support
customer_reviews.text: The display is drab and unnecessarily too complex. However, what is really disappointing is the tech support. They have a horrible support system. No live person and only voice mail. They do not call back after leaving multiple messages. I left messages on 5/20/19 and 5/21/19. Nothing! I'm sorry I ever purchased this item.
customer_reviews.author: Rick U

customer_reviews.title: It is good; very good
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine here on April 2013. I still have a working unit. Not the same, had to replace after a while - for free (customer service was fine with that and my other dumb questions)... Its on top of a 20 foot pole off the eve of the second story facing right into the NH Atlantic Ocean.500 yards away, so its had a strenuous weather test! It is still working fine, the solar is working, etc. So thanks! (Putting up the pipe was tough - be warned...) :)
customer_reviews.author: Linc

customer_reviews.title: A great instrument
customer_reviews.text: My 30 year old, multi-piece, hard wired Davis weather station was almost completely dead, only temperature and wind speed were left. When the temperature failed, I knew I needed to spring for a new station, and wow, I am pleased. The Davis 6252 is a snap to install, and has so much more then my original. I love the charts of temperature, wind speed, etc.,and the free Davis WeatherLink app, puts it all on my phone! This is just a great instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Guy

customer_reviews.title: A good profuct!
customer_reviews.text: This Davis Weather Station Model 6250 is the second one I have purchased. It has many features which necessitates a careful reading of the manual to implement them. It works just great. My last one survived Hurricane Matthew which struck Hilton Head Island in October of 2016. I forgot to take it in when we evacuated. When I returned home, it was still standing and still working. Less expensive weather stations cannot get the outdoor temperature right and usually read about 6 degrees too high. the Davis does get it right through some advanced engineering and that makes it worth the money in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Maury T

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic for 18 months and the quietly started dying. First rain gauge failed... Even changing battery, cleaning out funnel, and bringing unit up to house failed to get it working... Solar still functions because I still get temp, but wind is now obviously incorrect readings.
customer_reviews.author: James Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This replaces an accuweather station that was giving very poor temperature readings. Pretty easy to set up, comes with a lot of paperwork. I wish the console was larger or had larger numbers. The back light is kind of a yellow that is not that bright. As far as accuracy, the temperature outside is close to what the weather reports are. The wind speed updates are every few seconds which is night and day better than the accuweather station.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Weather station
customer_reviews.text: I like this weather station. I did some research and found it was more reliable than some of the others. A little over priced for such fragile plastics item. Also, the bubble for leveling should be on the bottom. I climbed up the ladder so I could see the bubble level that is on the top while mounting on a mast and fell off the ladder from 15 feet. Luckily my neck broke my fall and I was not injured.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Solar panel, no batteries needed.
customer_reviews.text: BEST feature is that the outdoor unit has a solar panel and doesn't need batteries. WORST feature is the inside unit's appearance is boring, monochromatic and lackluster. Okay, that's just me! I'm challenged when reading directions\instructions and this requires lots of navigating. Granted, it will tell you EVERYTHING you ever wanted to know about the weather, but i don't find it intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: ScooterRay

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and problematic.
customer_reviews.text: Sent back for refund ... sorry but I dont recommend this unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Willeecue

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 11 months. Replaced the battery and it didn’t help. Perhaps it is a capacitor. For the price, it should be more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisR

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Nice weather station.. This is everything I expected. Just wish I could find a cable to bring out the expansion header to a USB port. Super easy to set up and install. Good instructions Console was logging data before I got in from erecting the 10 foot long 1 inch EMT "pole" with the sensor suite on it. Top brand and one of their less pricey units. Displays everything I wanted. Tom
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: This is the right one.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weather station. A nice dependable unit at a reasonable price. Easy to assemble and install and I think quite accurate. I live in Arizona and I found the temperature sensor to work properly even during the hot weather in the summer. I have had it up for more than a year and the original batteries are just fine. The interface is in my office about 75 feet away from the unit and they have never dropped contact wirelessly. Easy to read information always on the screen and fun to "have the facts".
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, a wealth of info.
customer_reviews.text: We're completely delighted with this. The combination of solar power and wireless transmission makes installation a breeze, and let us install it on our well house, a small building without the heat or wind-shadow effects that our main house has. The historical data is interesting, no matter which function (temperature, humidity, precipitation or whatever) you are reviewing. A small downgrade for the LCD display, which is monochrome and with only fair contrast. Still, on balance, a good product. We've tried many less-expensive units, notably those from Oregon Scientific over the years, but this one is our new favorite. I ham-handedly broke a part while assembling it, and Davis replaced with with no argument promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality weather station
customer_reviews.text: All in one weather station that was easy to install and fun to keep track of your weather and not your local airport miles away. So far it’s been working fine, seems accurate compared to local forecast and other thermometers, but haven’t had any rain since purchasing because it doesn’t rain in the desert that often, but can’t wait until it does.
customer_reviews.author: P. Giralte

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than I thought to set up and get running live.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this yesterday so I can't tell how long it will last, but the installation went a heck of a lot easier than I thought it would. Very simple precise instructions. The hard part is mounting it. I took my time and did some research and got all the stuff I needed and it went very smoothly. So when I went to link it up to the counsel, that went great as well. Just follow the simple steps. I also got the Weather link device and in about 10 minutes I was live online with weather link and with weather underground..
customer_reviews.author: Jhon

customer_reviews.title: Costs a little more, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 cheaper brand weather stations before this one, and they both had problems with accuracy and connectivity. This one so far works flawlessly. I especially like how I can put it in full sun and the thermometer doesn't spike up. Davis makes a fancier model (Vantage Pro) that is supposed to add some other features, but I like how this is all integrated into one unit for easy mounting. The software that comes with it is obviously very dated and of limited usefulness. But I got a free account with Wunderground and upload my data to the web through that. It's neat to be able to monitor the weather at my house from anywhere in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Davis Instruments 6250 Vantage Vue
customer_reviews.text: Have had this set up now for about 10 months (think I waited on the review to make sure it would d a good job around winter and during bad weather). It's great, provides all sorts of info, and was easy to set up. You absolutely MUST spring for the mounting kit. We're up on a hill and get lots of wind and it has proven to be able to handle every thing just fine. Definitely professional grade. And the manufacturers have a sense of humor.....during one particularly heavy rain storm, the display actually read "It's Raining Cats and Dogs".
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: After 10 years, still going
customer_reviews.text: Yep... 10 years and still the most reliable I've had. The LCD is not the best nor the easiest one to read, but it does the job. If it had a better, more modern screen would be a perfect 10.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carneiro

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend if you are a weather watcher
customer_reviews.text: This will be my second Vantage Vue weather station. The first one lasted 10 years. We live in Missouri so the unit sees a substantial variation of harsh weather conditions and other than changing out batteries every several years, the unit has kept on performing. The old adage of "you get what you pay for" I think absolutely applies here. Davis puts out a quality product, set up is reasonably simple and you can count on its reliability. If I'm still around in another 10 years I'll buy another one. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Love this weather station - and we've had it for seven years!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this station in 2010 from Amazon - so I've been using it for 7 years. We live in a rather extreme climate, so I would expect it to have taken a beating. It has, and it's held up. Records accurately. Gives us all the data we want. Love it so much that I'm buying another for a family member for Christmas this year. Very easy to setup and use, and very easy to maintain. We change the batteries and make sure the rain gauge is clear of any debris, and we get everything we wanted in a weather station. 100% satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: KarenH

customer_reviews.title: Good accurate unit
customer_reviews.text: Good unit that replaced my 3rd LaCrosse, data is good I just wish the display was larger and in color. FYI I could not get over 15 months from the LaCrosse units and as soon as they determined it was out of warranty they hung up on you.
customer_reviews.author: Semi Hysterical  in Ky

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of information
customer_reviews.text: The 6250 Vantage Vue weather station has just about everything you could want in a remote weather station. I have both a Davis and Accurite weather station and find the only difference (aside from more information readily available on the Davis console) is the accuracy of the rain gauge in the Davis Vantage Vue. The difference between the two can be as much as a half an inch......which is a lot. I'm still working on which is more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Stringkingde

customer_reviews.title: Very well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I looked and looked for a couple of years and kept coming back to the Davis brand. It might cost a little more, but so far after 2 months, I am very well pleased with it. Easy to set up. The app works on the Android as well as the iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two failures in 48 hours. Unimpressive
customer_reviews.text: Rain gauge failed in the first 20 minutes of operation. Yes, it was installed 20 minutes before a torrential downpour and it didn't report a drop. After less than 48 hours the transmitter battery started to fail. I've emailed Davis support and I'll give them a chance, but if I had kept the packaging, the unit would be on its way back to them. I paid WAAAY too much for a hangar roof ornament.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Florey

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service
customer_reviews.text: This weather station seems to be far superior to a cheaper one I had which failed in 6months. It has a longer range and more frequently updated data. I received it promptly but when assembled it failed to connect to console and after many trouble shooting discover a dead lithium battery. Called Davis tech support and was talking to a tech in less than a minute. He made several recomendations to get me started and promised to send a new battery. Since the defective battery was unforseen and the quality of the product and service by Davis I can recommend this with 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Lininger

customer_reviews.title: We really like it!
customer_reviews.text: I received this for Mother's Day. I had a different weather station, which I had problems with and it finally quit working. My son has this same weather station and liked it so we thought we'd get the same one. The only reason I put three stars for tech support is because I haven't had it long enough to need tech support.
customer_reviews.author: sar

customer_reviews.title: So far, survived 45MPH winds!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We are using this to monitor a remote site, and so far, so good. It has survived 45MPH sustained winds with no issues! The data is visible to everyone after connecting it to Wunderground.com. Pricier than many out there but solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: FrankTop Contributor: Astronomy

customer_reviews.title: Nice System
customer_reviews.text: Had a Davis system for years and one of the remotes stopped working. Replacement was no longer available. Purchased this unit. Presently running both old and new systems without interaction. Works well. Display is a little bit busy but provides all the information you could want.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Weather Station for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a decades-old, wired Davis weather station that had stopped communicating with my computer 10 years ago and finally died altogether. The Vantage Vue was easy to set up and worked as described right out of the box. I already had the mounting pole so installation only took a few minutes. I have not had it long enough to judge reliability or durability, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Brent D

customer_reviews.title: Best Weather Station Available
customer_reviews.text: Davis Instruments manufactures extremely high quality products. The reason I bought this is I have a Davis Vantage Pro 1 that is over 12 years old and still in perfect working order. Keep in mind the product has been outdoors for all 12 years and has withstood everything from 108 degree temperatures to 7 degrees along with high winds and blazing sun. To date this product has performed flawlessly. Installation is a cinch and the readings are very accurate. If you are on a budget I recommend this. If you can afford it I would recommend the Davis Vantage Pro 2.
customer_reviews.author: VulcanFire

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the depth of information this unit provides and it seems very accurate although I have little to compare it with. Being just a weather enthusiast and not a professional, it gives me more than enough info. Easy to set up, its ready to go with little fuss. Just plan on spending an hour or so getting it installed and a little while longer initiating and setting it up. Only downsides are that the display is primitive and extracting info isn't exactly straight forward. You'll need to tinker with it on a regular basis to learn how to cycle through all the features but it's not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Winter

customer_reviews.title: Great weather Station !
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old (other brand) weather Station finally died, so I was looking for a good, affordable replacement. I read all the reviews and decided on the Davis Vantage Vue. After 2 months of use, I love it. If you are at all handy, it is easy to set-up. Took a few minutes to 'acquire' the signal, but has worked flawlessly since installing it above my garage. A great weather Station for the advanced Weather amature. It is well built and easy to use. I have not tried to link it to my computer, the supplied console is completely adequate. I am a happy weather watcher again.
customer_reviews.author: bigjon

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: I've always have been interested in weather conditions, having grown up on a farm in Western Pennsylvania. The Davis 6250 is a nice weather station that gives you as much information as you will normally need. It was very easy to set up and seems to give good results. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: The best weather station I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The best weather station I've ever had, and I've had a few over the last 20 years. I've been operating 3 of these for the last 5 years. Very reliable. Weak point is the backup battery. It requires changing at least once a year, and that can be a challenge depend on where you mount the station. I recommend taking that into consideration when picking a mounting location. Backup battery gets weak during very cold, cloudy, short-sun winter weather. The IP version uploads weather to various weather sites flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: CConnorRN

customer_reviews.title: Long Term Test - Great Unit!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for 3 years and it has worked flawlessly. It seems accurate and reliable, what more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: G. Ewert

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Rock-Solid
customer_reviews.text: I've had a number of weather stations over the year and this one is the best. Highly accurate and very sturdy. Set up was a breeze. The display is a little dated, but provides all the info you need and works well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: G. Ifland

customer_reviews.title: This device its number one for humidity temperature wind speed ...
customer_reviews.text: This device its number one for humidity temperature wind speed wind direction Atmospheric pressure and the lowest and highest data during the day of the month. Rain gauge. Alarms and warnings. Integrated weather station. 5 Starr
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Al Badwawi

customer_reviews.title: Nice station.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Easy to mount, set up and use. Did not have frustrating connection issues like I had repeatedly with my LaCrosse station. If this one lasts like the LaCrosse did without the connection issues I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Beamer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted one for years
customer_reviews.text: WONDERFUL to know OUR weather, right where I live, not miles away at an airport, or university. I love it. Knowing the temperature and wind, is very important to how I dress for my daily walk. At 87, I have to be right with that, or sweat or be cold. Neither is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Backyard Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: Great weather station! I'm a weather watcher since my pilot days and this system gives me my local weather conditions 24/7. I like the solar panel recharging the batteries and the wind/temp/rain gauges are perfect to track what's happening in my back yard versus what is happening at the airport which is 20 miles away...now I know how much rain I'm getting each day/month/year and if the temp is below freezing do I need to cover the plants or run the pool pump. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BaR Lodge

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We mounted it high on the roof peak and use the info every day. Ita a simple interface, which means a lot of nerd details are not available. We love the accurate info we receive from it.
customer_reviews.author: Kuda

customer_reviews.title: I love this weather station
customer_reviews.text: I love this weather station. Easy to read and easy to setup. Don't tighten the wind vane down too much as will throw off the wind mph measurements. I used a steel pole from lowes with fast acting concrete mix to mount it but make sure it is the right diameter as noted in the instructions or will not hold tightly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Shawver

customer_reviews.title: I have been very disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.text: I have been very disappointed in this item. I have had cheaper stations (<$100) that did as well or better. The measured wind speed is only about 40% of the actual, and the rain measurement is also consistently under actual (compared to simple rain gauges).It also irks me that the rain measurement is 24-hour periods beginning and ending at midnight, (There is a monthly and weekly also). Temperature seems to be fairly accurate although my reading is consistently 1-3 degrees below what is reported for my area on media sites.It is at an optimal location so that's NOT the problem. So basically, I paid over $300 for a thermometer. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kyzer

customer_reviews.title: Not a toy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Not a toy. A friend has had this model for the past 7 years and it has worked flawlessly. Im looking forward to many years of good service from this device.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Has worked flawlessly for years
customer_reviews.text: Mine is several years old now and has worked flawlessly. It is mounted on top of a 15 foot pole in the middle of a field 200 feet from the house with a clear line of site. My only complaints- menu could be better and I have to turn on its light to read the screen easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Willoughby

customer_reviews.title: It Just Works.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several weather stations from the other company and they always fail after just a short time. I finally decided to spend the extra money and get this one. You get what you pay for. This weather station was a snap to set up. It has never lost the data link with the base station, all the sensors work as designed. I have mine connected to my PC and send data to the Weather Underground (My station KAZMARIC9) If you want a weather station that just works buy from Davis... The other day the display said "It is raining cats and dogs" and yes it was pouring.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Price

customer_reviews.title: Look no further.
customer_reviews.text: This device does all it advertises and so much more. Tons and tons of data...if you want it. Or you can just have the basics displayed. The engineers who designed this had a sense of humor as well. One afternoon we were having an absolute downpour during a thunderstorm. On the display where it normally shows the rain amount, it simply said "Raining Cats and Dogs". Great weather station. Please note, if you buy the optional stand, assembly time will be more than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Galloway

customer_reviews.title: easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I have a tendency not to read directions, but for this product I did and everything went smoothly. Up and running in 30 minutes. I replaced a weather station from a company in the Midwest that lasted only a year. Since I had a post attached to my chimney that made installation of the Davis unit easier. Having everything in one unit is great. My last station had 3 instruments to install, which had to be turned on in a certain order. The Southern California sun was tough on the other station, we will see in a year how this Davis likes warm weather on the coast.
customer_reviews.author: pointsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Professional Quality, Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: Replacing an old Honeywell which has had the outside anemometer unit fail twice, I wanted a longer-lasting unit, as changing out the pole-mounted sender is a pain for me. My meteorologist friend recommended Davis. It's a great choice. The Vantage Vue gives me all the data I want and more. Easy to assemble, mount and program; nice wireless range. Extremely rapid and apparently accurate data. Clear display. I mark it down only for NOT having a self-setting clock, which I'd expect on a unit of this overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Uhler

customer_reviews.title: I believe Davis is the best weather station available
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country where much of my time is outdoors and I need a good weather station. My last Davis station lasted 20 years, and I could probably repair it, but opted for the latest version.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Fakler

customer_reviews.title: I always believe the Davis over the La Crosse temp but it's nice to have the two for comparison
customer_reviews.text: This weather station has been up for over a year, It runs in parallel with a La Crosse weather station. The temps can vary 0-5 degrees depending on the amount of sun light. I always believe the Davis over the La Crosse temp but it's nice to have the two for comparison. If your looking for an accurate tempature/rain/wind speed indicator then this is probably the best out there for the money. The next step up is another Davis instrument for another $100 and for the average homeowner I don't believe that it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Product set-up takes a little while but worth it. Data accuracy top notch. A little outage not covered in manual but Tech Support was outstanding. Sent detailed outline of problem in an email, next day a technical support call outlined my problem, talked me through the fix and it's good-to-go. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Display could be better
customer_reviews.text: Like this weather station. It is very accurate . I have it mounted on my boat house at least 1000' away and the reception is excellent in the house. The wind chill has never worked on the display. It always shows the same temperature as the outside temperature. My only complaint is the display. It could be better. I had a lacrosse weather station before this and the display was excellent but the range was poor and the sensors where not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby M Talbert

customer_reviews.title: 5 years with no failures
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit since 2012 without any failures and have replaced the battery 4 times with the shortest interval being 3 months because of a poor battery. A lithium cell lasts about 1 year and there is at least 2 weeks warning the battery is failing. I live in central Texas so not much snow, but it tolerated 2 inch snowfall without difficulty, as well as a couple of 4+ inches of rain storms and up to 60 mph winds. The only downside I can think of is getting up the 12 foot pole to reach the battery.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Super weather system
customer_reviews.text: Has worked perfectly for over a year. Wish I had purchased the next level up (a bit more expensive) which provides UV information and can handle added external sensors. Software interface has me online with all the major sites such as Weather Underground. Replaced another brand, whose rain gauge and anemometer kept failing, wish I had bought this one originally.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Nipe

customer_reviews.title: We love this thing
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing. I mounted it on a building 60 feet or so from the house about 15 feet from the ground. Reading correspond with other thermometers and rain gauges, and easy to read and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied with this product. Installation of the ISS was a bit tricky . Because I live at the beach I used 1" galvanized pipe for the mast. Since the ISS has to be accessible for maintenance and cleaning I set 14' of pipe into a socket on my upper deck and clamped it to the roof fascia with lag screws. This allows me to easily take down the entire setup in minutes. Hurricane/tropical storm Maria is headed my way so the weather station should get a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: dar

customer_reviews.title: A Weather Sation that Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I had gone through two LaCrosse wireless rain gauges in two years. The battery would just not last and there were other problems. This station works very well and gives me more information than I need, however that is way better than none. It has a range of 1,000 feet which seems rather long, however, every time a signal goes through a wall, the range drops in half. Consequently, stations with a range of only 300 feet (very common) often have problems -- this one did not. Setup is not hard, but diffidently requires reading Davis' instructions closely.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Love that this is all one unit outside
customer_reviews.text: Our last weather station had several different pieces outside, requiring batteries for each piece. I love that this is all one unit! Lots of extra features and has worked very well for the 4 months we've been using it
customer_reviews.author: Janice Goodman

customer_reviews.title: 5+ years of service.
customer_reviews.text: In over 5 years, had to clean out rain gauge twice, but otherwise flawless operation. The wind gauge doesn’t show accurate wind speed, but I had no treeless area to mound it so I believe that causes an unusual low wind speed.
customer_reviews.author: Windcrest Critic

customer_reviews.title: Reliable instrument
customer_reviews.text: Our other 2 weather machines turned into random numbering machines after 2 years, so this time we spent the money and are very happy with the Davis machine.
customer_reviews.author: Bergeek

customer_reviews.title: Really good Weather station
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a couple other stations that I thought were quit good but this beats them by a long shot. true it did cost about $40 more then the previous ones I owned but well worth it. What I really like is that it is "all in one" don't have to find a place for the range gauge, temp. sensor and wind sensor. this also has more internal memory and will hold a few months of data. So far the only draw back is you need to purchase an additional piece of hardware to pull the data off if you so wish.
customer_reviews.author: Dennist

customer_reviews.title: I must say that since I got mine I have absolutely loved it. It works flawlessly and does a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I had always wanted one of these but they are quite pricey so I was hesitant. I must say that since I got mine I have absolutely loved it. It works flawlessly and does a lot of little things that aren't really discussed here. One note, try to mount the station at the highest point possible. I live on a lot with a lot of trees and it seems that they block the wind at times. If I had mounted it higher I think I would have better results.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G. Lassiter

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately replacement parts are inexpensive and easy to find
customer_reviews.text: The wind speed and direction sensors are plastic and will break. Fortunately replacement parts are inexpensive and easy to find. Easy to install and use. Doesn't cost a fortune compared to other weather sensors out there. If you are looking for the backyard unit to get accurate information on rain, wind and temperature. Here's your unit. If you need something for scientific purposes, you are going to need to pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Diddle Den

customer_reviews.title: Great system.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. I had a mast from a previous station, so installation was quick and easy. The software setup is kind of clunky and awkward to use, though. I bought WeatherSnoop3, which is designed to work with Davis, and it is far superior and easier to setup sand use. I like the solar panels on the unit, which eliminates the need to go up on the roof to replace batteries periodically. I use the AC adapter so the batteries are backup.
customer_reviews.author: ChasL

customer_reviews.title: Had it 2 years-still working great!
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be accurate. It is definitely durable. The inside monitor is easy to read. Fun thing to have!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Jenson

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This is soooooo much better than the aging Oregon Scientific WMR 200 it replaced. Better build construction of the sensor suite and much, much much better console in house.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: as described
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. For a novice, the instructions should remind the buyer that the direction arrowhead points to the direction the wind is coming from and the tail is opposite. Some may think the direction of the wind may be the opposite as an arrow flies.
customer_reviews.author: james f. horn

customer_reviews.title: Davis Instruments 6250 Vantage Vue Wireless Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: A very compact and accurate package of essential weather measurement instruments. Combines the sensors in a very neat package that can be installed with one pole which allows the instruments to be elevated well above ground level thus reducing any ground effects that would affect wind and rain measurements. Barometric pressure is right on as measured against my precision barographs. Appears to be well made and very convenient to install. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: RockDoc

customer_reviews.title: Very easy set up to get started. Excellent refresh rate
customer_reviews.text: Never called tech support yet. Set it up no problem. Will have to get the up link then call. Totally happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth.A.Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  If it quits I'll get another just like it!
customer_reviews.text: We have loved this. I got it for my husband for Christmas. Easy to install and great to have on the place. We live far from the city so it's great to be able to see all the different readings that is offered.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy R.

customer_reviews.title: ... business for many years and it has always performed great without any issues
customer_reviews.text: We've had two of these at our place of business for many years and it has always performed great without any issues. My wife and I are weather junkies so we decided it was time to get something reliable at home, it works great we love it !!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Weather Station!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Davis 6250 a few days ago! I found installation to be very simple! One 8 foot 4x4 and the included hardware along with 8 inches of 1.5 galvanized pipe. Cheap and done! I did sink the 4x4 a foot or so into the ground and used cement to make sure it will remain very sturdy! It sits right in my landscape border. The station has displayed everything very nicely! This is a much nice station than the one it replaced! The solar power is very nice!
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best station for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I think the previous reviewers have pretty much said it all as far as features, functionality, etc. The only thing I have to add is that if you are waffling between the Davis and an Oregon Scientific unit, give each vendor a call and ask some general questions. You will get a real good feel for which unit is better just by the response you get from each. In my experience, Oregon seems to have little or no support. Davis can be tough to get a hold of, but when you do get in touch with them (either over the phone or via email), you will get an answer one way or another.
customer_reviews.author: Howright

customer_reviews.title: weather
customer_reviews.text: I love knowing what the temp, rain, humidity, wind is doing. This is my second station and I love it. Sent my first one back for cleaning and service. Now, I have a back up. BTW...Davis people are great and VERY helpful!
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Warning: The ISS began having problems after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy our Davis Vantage Vue and ISS when it's working. We have had it for 4 years now, but 18 months into its life, the ISS stopped transmitting. We changed out the batteries, and it began to transmit again. However, now requires a battery change every 2 months. We have reached out to Davis with no response.
customer_reviews.author: D-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Davis Instruments!
customer_reviews.text: A really well-made system that has been behaving perfectly since installing it two months ago. Display is clear and large enough for me to read without my glasses. What sets this apart from other similar products is its "graphing" feature that shows the past 25 hours/days/years of any selected parameter, and the "weather center" that provides additional information about the selected parameter. I can see all current conditions at a glance and get more information with a few button taps. Nicely done!
customer_reviews.author: mikeBL

product_meta.title: Davis Instruments 6250 Vantage Vue Wireless Weather Station with LCD Console
product_meta.description:
This wireless weather station provides accurate, reliable weather monitoring in a self-contained, easy-to-install system. Includes outdoor sensor array and LCD console. Mounting hardware included; mounting pole sold separately.

AMAZON.COM
The 6250 Vantage Vue Wireless Weather Station provides accurate, reliable weather monitoring in a self-contained, easy-to-install system. Designed to provide the weather data you need for home use, educational purposes, boating and more, the Vantage Vue includes a sleek but tough outdoor Integrated Sensor Suite (ISS) and a comprehensive console. The ISS sets up in minutes and starts sending data wirelessly to your console anywhere in your home, school, or business--within a 1,000-foot range. The ISS updates to the easy-to-read LCD screen on your console every 2.5-seconds. Constantly updated readouts provide you with current weather conditions, including indoor and outdoor temperature, humidity, barometric pressure, wind speed and direction, dew point, and rainfall. The user-friendly console features a backlit, 3 by 4.375-inch LCD screen and a glow-in-the-dark keypad that allows you multiple views and functions including weather forecasting, moon phase and sunrise/sunset times, graphing of weather trends, alarms and more. Vantage Vue's innovative Weather Center button will display additional data on weather variables for today and over the last 25 days. Finally, with the optional WeatherLink data logger and software you can gain access to additional weather analyses in a variety of versions.

 



The sleek and tough Integrated Sensor Suite (ISS) is built to stand up to intense weather conditions. Console Features: * Forecast Icons: Icons let you know to expect sun, part sun, clouds, rain, or snow. 
 * Variable Display Options: See updated variables every 10 seconds for heat index and wind chill to get a better "feel" for the outside environment. 
 * Weather Center: provides additional information for each weather variable, such as daily highs and lows, temperature changes by the hour and barometric value changes. Also displays astronomical data such as meteor showers. 
 * User-Friendly Keypad: Domed buttons are easy to sense and press. Glow-in-the-dark keypad offer day and night usability. 
 * Retransmits: Main console can extend range to additional consoles up to 1,000 feet away. 
 * Graphs: Graph the last 25 hours, days or months. View up to 50 graphs including temperature, rain, rain rate, wind and barometric pressure--all on the console. 
 * "This Time Yesterday" Feature: Data point on the graph indicates the weather during the same time yesterday to help compare and analyze day-to-day weather trends. 
 * Alarms: Set 22 simultaneous, different alarms to warn of dangers such as high winds, freezing temperatures, rain rate, flood warning, and more. 
 * Time and Date: View the current time and date or the time of sunrise/sunset. 
 * Moon Phase: See the eight phases of the moon from new to full. 
 * Barometer: Five-position trend arrow shows whether barometric pressure is rising, falling, or stable. 
 * Temperature and Humidity: Console updates outside temperature every 10 seconds and inside temperature every minute. In addition, outside humidity updates every 50 seconds and inside humidity every minute. 
 * Rain: Console updates rain totals and rain rate every 20 seconds for the last 25 hours, days, months. 
 * Wind Speed: See wind speed updates every 2.5 seconds, in miles per hour, meters per second, kilometers per hour, and knots. Provides the average and high wind speed for two-minute and ten-minute intervals. 
 * Units of Measure: Data is reported in US standard units. 

 Integrated Sensor Suite (ISS) Features:

 * Wireless: Frequency-hopping spread spectrum radio frequency from 902 to 928 MHz ensures consistent transmission up to 1,000 feet from integrated sensor suite to console. Survived cyclic corrosion tests simulating wear in extreme weather environments 
 * Solar-powered with stored energy backup: Solar Panel energizes the station during the day. On-board super capacitor provides power at night. Lithium battery provides backup when needed. 
 * Rain Collector: Self-emptying tipping spoon measures rain with 0.01-inch resolution. 
 * Anemometer: Records wind speeds from two to 150 miles per hour. 
 * Wind Direction: Measures wind direction in compass points or degrees. 
 * Temperature/Relative Humidity: Outside temperature readings from -40 to 150 degrees Fahrenheit (-40 to 65 degrees Celsius). Measures relative humidity from 0 to 100 percent. 
 * Weather Proof Cover: is corrosion-resistant and extremely durable. Electronics are potted or over-molded for added moisture shielding. 
 * Radiation Shield: protects from solar radiation and other sources of radiated and reflected heat. 
 * Easy Installation with included mounting hardware kit. 
 * Bubble Level: Allows for more accurate installation and better data collection. 

 What's in the Box?
Integrated Sensor Suite (ISS), LCD console, mounting hardware
feature_bullets: Self-contained weather monitoring system includes Integrated Sensor Suite (ISS), LCD console, and mounting hardware (mounting pole sold separately)
Console features an easy-to-read, backlit 3 by 4.375-inch LCD display with a glow-in-the-dark keypad
Wireless transmission from ISS to console of up to 100 yard with fast updates every 2.5 seconds
Reports current weather conditions, including indoor and outdoor temperature, humidity, barometric pressure, wind speed and direction, dew point, and rainfall
Console includes weather forecast icons, moon phase, sunrise/sunset times, graphing of weather trends, alarms and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
